Empires & Puzzles Smarttongue Review: The Goblin Bard's Guide

Smarttongue brings a unique melody to Empires & Puzzles. This Goblin Bard doesn't just sing; she permanently withers enemy attack and slashes their max health. Discover if her tune still holds up in the modern era of massive stats or if she is just playing second fiddle.
Smarttongue: The Bard Who Withers Your Soul
Smarttongue, The Toxic Virtuoso: Wither, Weakness, and Wails

Smarttongue is a 5-star Legendary Nature (Green) hero from the Goblin family, originally introduced in September 2023. As a support hero with a nasty streak, she specializes in crippling the enemy team rather than wiping them out with raw damage. Her kit introduces the "Wither" mechanic, a permanent stat reduction that persists through the battle. While she hails from an era before the massive stat explosions of late 2024 and 2025, her unique utility keeps her in the conversation for players looking to dismantle tanky defenses or neutralize high-attack threats. She is a bard who plays a song of attrition, and if you let her finish her set, you might find your team too weak to lift their weapons.

Smarttongue's design fits perfectly within the chaotic and slightly grotesque aesthetic of the Goblin Village. She is depicted as a manic bard, likely mid-performance, with an expression that suggests her lyrics are more vicious mockery than inspiring ballad. The color palette is dominated by the signature Goblin greens and earthy tones, with dynamic posing that conveys her energetic, albeit annoying, personality. It is the kind of face only a mother (or a desperate summoner) could love, but it certainly has character.

When comparing Smarttongue's stats to the modern benchmarks of late 2025, the ravages of time are evident. Modern heroes like Adelitza and Lin Chong boast attack and defense stats in the 1300s and HP over 2200. Smarttongue sits around 900 attack/defense and 1600 HP (without Limit Breaks).
Below average by today's standards, making her somewhat fragile without heavy emblem and aether investment.
Her health pool is noticeably shallower than the 2500+ behemoths roaming the arena today.

However, because her primary value lies in utility (Wither and Health Reduction) rather than direct damage scaling, she suffers slightly less from power creep than a pure sniper would. She needs protection to do her job, but her job remains effective.
, is a three-part harmony of destruction:

All enemies receive -250 Attack. This is the star of the show. Unlike standard defense down or attack down ailments, Wither modifies the character's base stats for the remainder of the battle. It generally cannot be cleansed (unless a specific hero mechanic allows removing "Wither" effects, which is rare). A -250 reduction is substantial; against a modern hero with 1300 attack, that is roughly a 19% drop. Against older heroes, it is even more devastating.

Reducing max health by 600 is a potent counter to healers and overhealers. It effectively caps the enemy's sustainability. If the enemy has boosted health, this effect hits harder, punishing teams that rely on overheating to survive.

A -45% defense against Special Skills for 4 turns makes the enemy team incredibly vulnerable to your subsequent nukers. This is distinct from general defense down and often stacks with it, allowing for massive damage spikes from your other heroes.
speed, she needs 10 tiles to charge. With a level 23 Mana Troop (or equivalent bonuses), you can drop this to 9 tiles, making her functionally much faster in 3-match scenarios.
with her main skill. However, her passive has a 50% chance to deal

908 (Base Atk) x 0.90 = ~817 damage spread across all enemies (before defense reduction). This is negligible chip damage in the current meta and serves mostly to trigger "on damage" effects or finish off 1 HP enemies.
A 600 HP reduction to 5 enemies removes a total of
from the enemy team. This is often more valuable than dealing 3000 damage, as it cannot be healed back easily.
-250 Attack x 5 enemies = -1250 total attack power removed from the opposing side. This significantly lowers the incoming damage from both tiles (slash attacks) and special skills.
Family Bonus, Passives, Aether Power & Unique Abilities
The Goblin family is notorious for their Wither and Growth mechanics, which fundamentally alter the stats of heroes in play.

Smarttongue benefits from the standard Goblin interactions where Wither and Growth effects play a central role. While she applies Wither, she does not have a specific "Family Bonus" listed in the traditional sense like the "2/3/4/5 heroes" bonuses of older families, but relies on the inherent strength of the Goblin passive mechanics.
She has a 50% chance to cast an additional effect when firing her special:

Inflicts -25% accuracy for 3 turns.
This RNG element can be frustrating. When it lands, the blind (-25% accuracy) is a fantastic survival tool combined with the Attack Wither. When it fails, she feels purely supportive. A coin flip for survival utility is not ideal, but it is a nice bonus when it procs.

is a top-tier Aether Power for a support hero. It ensures that for the first 6 turns, Smarttongue cannot be silenced, mana-blocked, or defense-broken. This guarantees she will likely get at least one cast off, which is often all she needs to permanently cripple the enemy team's attack stat.

Upon release, Smarttongue was viewed with some skepticism due to her lack of direct damage on the main skill and the "squishy" nature of non-tank Goblins. However, players quickly realized the power of permanent Wither and massive Max HP reduction in long attrition battles and Rush wars. She became a key tool for dismantling overheal teams.

The stat gap is her biggest enemy. With new heroes launching with 1300+ stats, Smarttongue's ~900 stats leave her vulnerable to being one-shot by modern snipers before she can fire. Her utility is timeless, but her survivability is dated.

. She is no longer a set-and-forget defense hero due to her low stats. However, on offense, she remains a potent counter to healers and high-attack teams, provided you can keep her alive. In Rush Attack tournaments and wars, she is still a menace because she can fire early, permanently weakening the enemy before they ramp up.

, which is arguably the worst class for her kit. The Ranger talent (Pierce) allows attacks to bypass defensive buffs. Since her main skill does no damage, this talent only applies to her tile damage and the 50% chance passive damage. It is largely wasted on her.
Maximizes her survivability. She needs to live long enough to cast her skill. Her attack stat is irrelevant for her main utility.
Wastes the class talent nodes, but that is unavoidable.
Slightly increases tile damage and the passive damage.
She will die to a stiff breeze in the current meta.
path is the only logical choice. Ignore the Ranger nodes' offensive benefits and treat them purely as stat boosts.
The -250 Attack Wither lasts for the entire battle and effectively cannot be cleansed. It softens the enemy team permanently.
Reducing max health by 600 (more vs boosted) is a hard counter to heroes who rely on boosting health to survive.
A rare and powerful debuff that amplifies the damage of your other special skills significantly.
Grants her a safe window to charge up at the start of the match.
Her base stats are significantly lower than modern heroes, making her fragile.
Her damage and blind are locked behind a 50% coin flip.
The Ranger class talent provides almost zero value to her kit.
If she fires and the enemy cleanses the Special Defense Down (the Wither remains, but the Def Down goes), or if you lack follow-up damage, she doesn't win the match on her own.
Her Average speed becomes Very Fast. Dropping Wither and Max HP reduction early in a match forces the enemy into a panic.
Great for dissecting stall teams or teams heavily reliant on healers.
Very useful for bosses with massive HP pools; whittling down their max health makes the fight much shorter.
Smarttongue is an enabler. She sets the table; she doesn't eat the meal.
Smarttongue applies Special Defense Down. An Elemental Defense Down hero (like Almur) applies Green Def Down. A sniper then hits for astronomical damage numbers.
Stacking multiple Goblins allows you to wither both Attack and Defense, reducing the enemy team to paper-thin weaklings.
(e.g., Ludwig, Shacklebolt) force Smarttongue to apply her nasty debuffs to just one target, shielding the rest of the team.
with resistance can potentially resist the non-Wither effects.
Heroes who overwrite Defense Down with a weaker version, though her "Defense vs Specials" usually stacks with general Defense Down, so she plays well with most.

If you pulled Smarttongue, you have a gem. Even with lower stats, her ability to permanently reduce enemy attack will help you survive harder stages and raid against stronger teams. Max her out and focus on keeping her alive. She will be your safety net against teams that hit too hard.

Smarttongue is a niche pick for your roster. She is likely too statistically weak for your primary defense team. However, keep her for War depth, especially Rush wars. Do not prioritize Alpha Aethers for her unless you use her daily; there are newer heroes who benefit more from the stat boost. She does her job fine at 4/80 or 4/85 provided you protect her.
The community reaction to Smarttongue has been a rollercoaster.
Early on, users argued whether she was "squishy" or had "stout" stats. User
noted she felt squishy even at level 85, while others pointed out her stats were high
was prophetic; she is definitely squishy now.
As stated by a player in the forums, the Wither effect is considered "pure cancer" by opponents because it cannot be cleansed. This makes her incredibly frustrating to fight against in long matches.
Recent feedback suggests she has been "dethroned" by newer Goblins and the Garrison Guard heroes like Vanya, who offer more modern stats and counter-play.

Smarttongue is the definition of a "technical" hero. She doesn't have the flashiest damage numbers, but the unseen work she does—lowering enemy attack and capping their health—often decides the match. She is a relic of the early Goblin era, statistically dusty but mechanically sound. If you need someone to shut up a loud enemy team, this bard has the perfect song.
She might have a Smart tongue, but her stats are starting to need a hearing aid.
A strong utility hero for offense and specific tournament niches, but retired from top-tier defense duty.
